job_description: Principal Electrical Engineer - job post Milwaukee Electric Tool Corporation 510 reviews Chicago, IL Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Description: INNOVATE WITHOUT BOUNDARIES! At Milwaukee Tool we firmly believe that our People and our Culture are the secrets to our success – so we give you unlimited access to everything you need to create disruptive new technologies and solutions on our electrical engineering teams. Our Engineering Team is responsible for giving life to the batteries, motors, and electronics that power solutions changing the lives of our users. Every developmental phase of these critical components happens in-house under the watch of this team. We continue to invest in electrical engineering resources to design and develop leadership in electronic capabilities; something unique within the industry. And we’re pushing the limits in firmware engineering, power electronics, embedded systems, machine learning, and the use of artificial intelligence. Behind our doors you’ll be empowered every day to own it, drive it, and do what it takes to design and develop the biggest breakthroughs in the industry. Meanwhile, you’ll have the support and resources of the fastest-growing brand in the construction industry to make it happen. Year after year, our team continues to make significant breakthroughs in the industry. We’re just getting started. To learn more about our story click HERE . The Principal Embedded Systems Engineer will lead the design and implementation of testing of embedded systems and identify engineering trends to drive strategies and Milwaukee Tool’s technical direction. You will work through the product development process in a team environment interacting with cross-functional stakeholders such as hardware, firmware, product development, and reliability engineers. *This Engineer will sit onsite at our new Technology Innovation Center downtown Chicago, located in the Old Post Office on W. Van Buren St.* You’ll also be DISRUPTIVE through these duties and responsibilities: Manage and lead a small to medium size team of electrical engineers in the designing, prototyping, testing, and troubleshooting of embedded electronics for a variety of projects. Lead the development of concepts/schematics/test plans/procedures and test cases for new product embedded systems and subsystems development. Define and drive technical roadmaps identifying critical electronic components and creating robust design architectures. Mentor and coach the team in engineering best practices including task management, Gantt charts, root cause analysis, circuit / PCB design, and PCBA manufacturing. Effectively communicate and motivate up, down and across the organization to a diverse range of technical and non-technical team members. Own technical project schedules and work break down structure. Drive urgency in project schedules and accountability for establishing and achieving key project metrics that meet the organization’s needs. Ensure the team is given the time and resources required to succeed by creating and managing robust project roadmaps and resource plans with converged project scope. Effectively communicate up, down and across the organization to a diverse range of technical and non-technical team members. Develop plans to evaluate and assess the emerging technology market space to fit/compliment Milwaukee Tool product initiatives and development. Champion technology investigations including system requirements, architecture definitions, and reusability strategies. Quickly, effectively, and candidly frame-up and escalate business risks/opportunities to senior leadership. What TOOLS you’ll bring with you: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering Computer Engineering, or related field. 7+ years of embedded systems experience. 3+ years of experience leading, project managing, or mentoring a team. Understanding of digital circuits and the interaction between firmware and electronics. Ability to realize component level design. Practical knowledge in analog/digital system tradeoffs and design, especially related to signal integrity, noise analysis, and margin considerations. Familiarity with using schematic capture, PCB layout software, SPICE, and knowledge of industry best practices. Expertise in C programming and related development tools and processes, especially relating to microcontroller peripherals. Strong leadership experience. Self-motivated, organized, efficient, process oriented with a strong work ethic. Excellent problem-solving skills, exercises independent judgement and works well under pressure in a dynamic environment. Ability to travel 10% of the time (domestic and international). Other TOOLS we prefer you to have: Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field. Working knowledge of a second modern programming language such as Python or C++. We provide these great perks and benefits: Robust health, dental and vision insurance plans. Generous 401 (K) savings plan. Education assistance. On-site wellness, fitness center, food, and coffee service. And many more, check out our benefits site HERE .

Sr. Engineer 2, Systems (Hybrid) - job post Chamberlain Group 161 reviews Oak Brook, IL 60523 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options. Chamberlain Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem. This role is responsible for applying superior systems engineering knowledge to support NPD, sustaining, and productivity designs that have medium complexity. This role will be heavily involved in advanced development, system architecture, and platform development for new product development projects. This role has the technical ability to apply existing technology, both internal and with partners, to build large products. Additionally, this role will be responsible for maintaining engineering quality by mentoring interns/apprentices and peer reviewing designs. Job Responsibilities: Research technology and prototype new technology that support the lines of business product portfolio Define and Generate documentation for system architecture in new product development platforms Estimate time, resources and cost complete New Product Development deliverable and ensure completion to estimates Mentor interns and apprentices by reviewing work product and giving technical feedback Maintain engineering technical quality by peer reviewing designs Create SFMEA, DFMEAs, and 8Ds using Chamberlain’s quality tools Lead and participate in failure analysis and problem solving tactics by using Six Sigma design practices (Six Sigma is not required for this role, only preferred) Analyze network data to evaluate connectivity Design system architecture from cloud to connected products Build prototypes incorporating existing and COTS components while using basic project management skills. Test and troubleshoot complex systems that incorporate complex and simple products in a connected environment. Build prototypes incorporating existing and COTS components while using basic project management skills. Write technical documentation like specifications and test reports to support project deliverables. Conduct peer review for product design by acting as the technical reviewer on ECNs. Develop NPD project schedules by utilizing Microsoft Project. Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in systems, software, mechanical or electrical engineering and minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of eleven (11) years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties & Responsibilities; an advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience; Six Sigma Yellow Belt certification strongly preferred; or commitment to obtain certification within one (1) year of date of hire or promotion Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally Preferred Job Requirements: Experience with connected products, routers, switches, databases, electro-mechanical systems, and PCs; experience with wireless communication standards like WiFi or Bluetooth; experience with product safety standards for Chamberlain products like UL325, UL294 and IEC60335; experience with EMC regulatory standards for Chamberlain products like FCC, ETSI and ANZ4268 Ability to lead a team of engineers to create connected electromechanical products; strong analytical skills; ability to efficiently communicate to all levels of organization or outside partners; good presentation skills We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed. Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment. Sr. Engineer Firmware (Remote or Hybrid) - job post Chamberlain Group 161 reviews Oak Brook, IL 60523 • Remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options. Chamberlain Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem. This role is responsible for applying superior design and development to embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, full stack firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. A firm understanding of design patterns to create robust, scalable and re-usable software designs is required. This role will be involved with design decisions from concept through production. Collaboration with other areas of a cross functional team, such as marketing or manufacturing, throughout a product life cycle is required. Interface with senior management, creation and coordination of development schedules of limited complexity, implementing process, and execution of that process is also required. This role is expected to support and mentor interns and apprentices. Travel to facilities throughout the world is expected on an as needed basis. Job Responsibilities: Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations, and test cases. Work across business units with hardware and firmware developers to create designs modular across platforms. Generate detailed project plans for small teams of developers, manage Gantt charts, and Scrum backlog. Lead Agile initiatives around training, project planning, and tracking. Support new development processes and best practices per alignment with department goals. Partner with MyQ cloud architects to define connected solutions for B2B and B2C products. Design, develop and implement application-level firmware solutions to meet business need. Create new designs using existing technologies; socialize expertise and train developers as needed. Create new designs of moderate complexity with new technology, support platform design. Provide peer review by soliciting feedback on firmware, hardware, and connected software designs, implementation, and test. Act as support role in defining and developing functional development processes. Supervise small groups of developers to prioritize work, manage risk, and drive deliverables. Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing. Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library. Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams. Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies. Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed. Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, electrical engineering or computer science and minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of eleven (11) years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties & Responsibilities; an advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience; Six Sigma Yellow Belt certification strongly preferred; or commitment to obtain certification within one (1) year of date of hire or promotion. Agile/Scrum experience; experience in full product life cycle management. Strong analytical skills; effective communication skills. Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally. Preferred Job Requirements: Six Sigma Green Belt. Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Lead Data Scientist (Hybrid) - job post Chamberlain Group 161 reviews Oak Brook, IL 60523 • Hybrid remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Chamberlain Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem. Summary This role is responsible for developing and implementing models and algorithms to solve complex optimization problems to support CG’s strategic business priorities and enable data-driven decisions by business stakeholders. The Lead Data Scientist will work with other data scientists, data engineers, and senior leadership to understand requirements, develop technical solutions, and ensure the reliability and performance of the solutions. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Identify best analytical techniques to achieve Business Unit objectives; design, develop, and deploy advanced analytics solutions, including predictive and prescriptive outputs, analytical tools, and visualization capabilities to enable business users to make data-driven decisions Execute analytic activities supporting solution development, including data gathering, cleansing, and integration, statistical transformation and modeling, and feature engineering and selection Apply analytical techniques, including linear/non-linear models, clustering, optimization, simulation, forecasting, machine learning, and neural networks Collaborate with stakeholders and advanced analytics business partners to understand business needs and to identify and define advanced analytics solutions and to effectively communicate results Develop innovative solutions through deep understanding of internal and external data Create appropriate standards and processes to ensure quality and consistency of Advanced Analytics solutions Direct activities of third-party contractors / consultants for specific business projects Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed Minimum Qualifications: Education/Certifications: Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, operations research, industrial engineering, econometrics, or other quantitative field of study Experience: 7+ years of relevant work experience for Lead level (4+ for Senior level) Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Expert knowledge of operations research and mathematical modeling, including basic linear programming, non-linear programming, integer programming, and combinatorial optimization; as well as experience with heuristics algorithms Expert knowledge of advanced statistics and machine learning methods, including regression, classification, time series analysis, network analysis, clustering, simulation, dimension reduction Hands-on experience developing mathematical models and simulations to solve transportation, logistics, or network optimization problems Experience with modern optimization tools, libraries, and frameworks (e.g., CPLEX, Gurobi) Proficient in using SQL and Python or R to process and analyze data and create data visualizations Experience in manipulating, analyzing, and interpreting large-scale data Experience working distributed computer tools (e.g., Databricks, Apache Spark) Experience scaling analytics in the cloud (e.g., Azure) Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance Other: Preferred Qualifications Education/Certifications: Master's degree or Ph.D. in statistics, mathematics, operations research, industrial engineering, econometrics, or other quantitative field of study Experience: Experience working with Agile methodologies Experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI, Tableau) #LI-Hybrid We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed. Senior Software Engineer, C# - job post Reveal-Brainspace 8 reviews Chicago, IL 60606 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Senior Software Engineer, C# Location Chicago Job Overview Join an innovative and fast-paced team-building software that allows litigation professionals to filter millions of documents down to those most important to their case using advanced techniques and artificial intelligence. From your seat in Downtown Chicago, you’ll be developing technology that addresses complex challenges such as data visualization, machine learning, distributed systems, large databases, and large-scale data processing. We code primarily in C#, React, and Java. If you don’t know it “all,” you won’t be alone! We are seeking full-stack generalists that can bring experience and diverse knowledge to our team, rather than hyper-focused specialists. Our hiring staff is not focused on playing “technology experience bingo” but wants to find the best software engineers. As far as the development process itself, we don’t want to just check the boxes to be able to say that we have the most (or even the snazziest) features. Rather, we are thoughtful about our design and focused on ensuring that our clients can use software that is both useful and useable. You won’t be buried in a dark corner – you’ll have the opportunity to actively shape the software, while working as an integral part of a dynamic team of developers who are focused on writing great code, learning every day, and having a lot of fun. From your seat in our beautiful new office in downtown Chicago, you will have access to many teammates. Our office is in the heart of the loop with very convenient access to all major public transportation lines. Please be aware we are onsite with a traditional five-day work week schedule. This is a fully in-person role. Responsibilities and Duties Participate in the development of new features and expand existing features. Add support for new platforms to our existing products and develop new products. Develop and review designs, code, unit tests, system tests, and documentation. Collaborate in root cause analysis; diagnose, isolate, and fix software problems. Create applications using primarily C#. Design and implement RESTful APIs in C#. Demonstrate your work product to your team. Identify and correct issues that impact performance, reliability, and scalability. Investigate and develop skills in new technologies. Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Strong knowledge of C#. Knowledge of the software development lifecycle to include agile methodologies, code quality, and continuous integration/continuous delivery. Driven to build modern systems that emphasize user experience and aesthetics. Knowledge of React application development and testing is a plus. Characteristics A team player. Excellent writing and written/verbal communication skills. An eagerness to learn, explore and introduce new technologies. Must have authorization to work in the United States. Education & Experience Experience creating and consuming RESTful interfaces. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, a related field, or equivalent work experience. 10+ years’ work experience in back-end software engineering with considerable experience programming in C#. This job description reflects the present requirements of the position. As duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to amendment. Hiring Policy Reveal is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Reveal does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Reveal considers candidates with existing visas, but does not sponsor new visa applications.

Packaging Engineering Manager - job post Ingredion 460 reviews Westchester, IL Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time TITLE: Packaging Engineering Manager LOCATION: Bedford Park, IL; Indianapolis, IN; North Kansas City, MO REPORTS TO: Senior Director, Process Engineer Company Background: Ingredion is a Fortune 500 provider of ingredient solutions that helps nourish, comfort, sustain, and delight people around the world. Ingredion’s wide range of ingredient solutions is strategically designed to address changing consumer trends and preferences. Our specialty portfolio includes starch-based texturizers, clean and simple ingredients, plant-based proteins, sugar reduction and specialty sweeteners, and food systems. Our innovative ingredient solutions are used by consumers in everyday products, from foods and beverages to paper and pharmaceuticals. And we do it all in a planet-friendly sustainable manner. We bring the potential of people, nature, and technology together to make life better. That’s our purpose. We are all IN to make life better! Every day, Ingredion employees bring their skills, creativity, and passion together to deliver ingredient solutions that enhance people’s lives. We are innovators who combine the power of technology with the best of nature to delight our customers and consumers. We hold ourselves to the highest standards in ethics, safety, quality, and sustainability. Unlocking the potential of people, nature, and technology to make life better is what drives us in every aspect of our business. If you are interested in making life better, we are all IN to learn more about you! A bit about what you can expect from the employee experience at Ingredion: The chance to make a difference No matter where you work in the company, you’ll have an opportunity to make life better… for our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world. Passionate people, motivated to excel Our highly talented people have a passion for learning and achievement and are driven by our inspiring purpose to make life better and our core values: Care First, Be Preferred, Everyone Belongs, Innovate Boldly, and Owner’s Mindset. A warm, welcoming environment At Ingredion, everyone belongs! We embrace diversity and foster an inclusive work environment where individuals feel supported and enabled to contribute their very best every day. A place where you can grow personally and professionally We believe everyone has great potential, and we strive to nurture that potential into great personal and professional achievements. An environment that enables innovation and collaboration We are creating the conditions that inspire and enable innovation - in our products and services, as well as in how we do our work day-to-day. The Packaging Engineering Manager will provide a broad range of engineering expertise and technical support to all Ingredion locations in support of their safety, quality, manufacturing, and business goals. This includes mechanical design of solids handling, product packaging (dry powder) equipment and systems, process and equipment troubleshooting and optimization, development and review of potential projects and support during major project implementation. Provide a high level of technical leadership through mentoring, leading task forces and teams and answering technical requests. Provide coordination to assure that Ingredion has, or has access to, the best technology in its business units worldwide. Core Responsibilities: Partner with customers, both internal and external to deliver packaging solutions that enhance the customer experience both in the packaging materials used and the packaging equipment. Primary focus on packaging of bulk powders. Support a team environment that delivers innovative process improvements and provides process troubleshooting to resolve complex business issues. Maintain a high level of awareness of current and emerging technologies in dry powder packaging regarding equipment, engineering, design, regulatory requirements and make recommendations on their application to improve profitability of operations worldwide. Being up to date on leading edge packaging technologies for bulk powders and liquids will contribute to this role being Ingredion’s subject matter expert on packaging. Develop innovative ideas, concepts or techniques that may be useful to our business and operations. Provide technical consulting assistance to Ingredion and outside engineering personnel in engineering, design, equipment specifications, project reviews, installation, checkout, start-up, testing, troubleshooting and optimization to support project and plant objectives. Review and recommend appropriate equipment and systems for new capital projects and existing installations to ensure that they comply with known safety best practices, applicable codes, and standards. Provide the technical support required for the negotiations of national and international contracts for selected supplies and equipment, capital purchases, engineering services, and construction services that will ensure cost effectiveness to all locations served by the contracts. Provide technical support and leadership to teams with members involving operations management, maintenance, and engineering to achieve manufacturing excellence. Maintain the Company’s intellectual property to ensure competitiveness through proper record retention, mentoring engineers, and preparation of engineering standards, specifications, best practices, and design manuals. Provide coaching and develop tools to improve engineering skills throughout the entire organization. Anticipate customer needs and proactively create new solutions that exceed customer expectations. Ability to work effectively with people from different cultures to accomplish business objectives. Act as a mentor, offering advice and guidance to colleagues. Respect and value others’ differences, seeking opportunities to learn from those with different perspectives. Must be a self-starter, decisive, goals-oriented individual, capable of independent decision making with the ability to successfully meet targeted goals, on time and within budgetary constraints. Strong interpersonal skills suited to task force and consulting assignments and to directing or influencing others with the ability to interface effectively with team members, management, customers and vendors. Demonstrated application of sound judgment, resourcefulness, initiative, and innovation in handling complex technical assignments and integrating those solutions with business needs into decision making with minimal supervision. Proven ability to lead and facilitate in a team environment and build consensus in a positive manner with team members and customers. Qualified candidates will have: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering with a minimum of 10 years of experience of industrial mechanical engineering experience (Mechanical preferred; Chemical, Industrial, Packaging accepted; Electrical considered). Experience with packaging equipment (robots, metal detection, force flow packers, screeners, magnets, etc.) of bulk powders (primary focus) and liquids (minor focus). Demonstrated knowledge of sizing, design, fabrication, troubleshooting, failure analysis, GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), production measurements and safety requirements of packaging equipment. Knowledge of general mechanical technology such as strength of materials, machine design, fluid mechanics and materials of construction. Experience or familiarity with control systems and troubleshooting. A proven track record of a strong mechanical aptitude, analytical problem-solving skills, project management and creativity. Substantial experience in engineering, design, maintenance of mechanical systems and equipment in the food and ingredient manufacturing industry. Demonstrated ability to analyze and solve complex technical problems as applied to facilities design, operations consulting, equipment failures and troubleshooting. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to prepare effective presentations, present tests and results, and write concise reports, document process and operational procedures, and complete the required engineering documentation including P&ID development for new and/or modified equipment and processes. Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to train and work effectively with all experience levels. Proven ability of influencing others towards positive change both inside and outside the direct chain of command. Travel may constitute up to 25 percent of the time on the job and may consist of consecutive weeks in any of the Company facilities worldwide. Fluency in English required. A working knowledge of a Latin or Asian language would be a plus. Ingredion provides accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If a job applicant requires an accommodation during the application process or through the selection process, we will work with the applicant to meet the job applicant's accommodation needs. #LI-JS1 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, military status, or disability status. Relocation Available: Yes, Within Country
